column5: Here is a link to a site where invasive species can be reported.  http://www.eddmaps.org/Ontario/

Thanks, I see a lot of Garlic Mustard on town parkland here and escarpment walking trails, it's choking out the native vegetation and wildflowers in some areas. Nasty persistent stuff, on the bright side fields that used to be a mass of purple loosestrife seem to have far less purple blooms at that time of the season.

http://www.upi.com/Science_News/2015/02/10/Researchers-imagine-killer-shrimp-invasion-of-Great-Lakes/2401423582440/?spt=hs&or=sn  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dikerogammarus_villosus   The smallie food of the future? At 1.2 inches long it will take a lot of them!

Here is a link to a site where invasive species can be reported.  http://www.eddmaps.org/Ontario/ Good to know. At 1.2 inches long it will take a lot of them!  Hmmm interesting...Wonder if you can still eat em lol.
LOL Adam! Popcorn shrimp? I know some towns - cities along this side of Lake Erie that would like to see something that eats some of the muckleheads and mayflies?
